intro: Monnina polystachya, commonly known as prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of tiny flowers in late spring to early summer. Monnina polystachya is often used in native plant landscaping due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
